name: Introductory Interdisciplinary Topics in European Studies
description: Analysis of various aspects of European culture, science, and technology. Three lecture hours a week for one semester.   Only one of the following may be counted unless the topics vary: European Studies 301, 302, 306, 307, 308. May be repeated for credit when the topics vary. Prerequisite: Varies with the topic and is given in the Course Schedule.

name: Introduction to European Studies
description: The myths, ideas, and sociopolitical realities that underpin the intellectual and cultural construction of Europe. Core course. Three lecture hours a week for one semester.

name: Preparation for Study Abroad in Europe
description: One lecture hour a week for one semester.   May not be counted by students who have previously taken an international learning seminar. Offered on the pass/fail basis only.

name: Continuity and Change in Modern France
description: Same as French Civilization 340M. Focuses on various social, political, and cultural crises in France from the revolution of 1789 to the present time. Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Only one of the following may be counted: European Studies 340M, French 340T, French Civilization 340M. May not be counted toward fulfillment of the foreign language requirement for any bachelor's degree. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing.

name: Governments and Politics of Western Europe
description: Same as Government 324L. Comparative study of peoples, institutions, parties, interest groups, and bureaucracy in the countries of Western Europe, concentrating on the major political systems of Britain, France, Germany, and Italy. Three lecture hours a week for one semester. European Studies 350 and Government 324L may not both be counted. Prerequisite: Six semester hours of lower-division coursework in government.

name: Germany and Europe since 1945
description: Restricted to students participating in the summer program in Wuerzburg, Germany.  The equivalent of three lecture hours a week for one semester. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing and consent of instructor.

name: Independent Research in European Studies
description: Tutorially directed research on a modern European topic. Conference course. Required for the concentration in European studies. May be repeated for credit. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing, admission to the European studies program, and consent of instructor.

name: Interdisciplinary Topics in European Studies
description: An analysis of various aspects of European culture, science, and technology. Three lecture hours a week for one semester.   Only one of the following may be counted unless the topics vary: European Studies 346, 347, 348, 363. May be repeated for credit when the topics vary. Prerequisite: Varies with the topic and is given in the Course Schedule.

name: Capstone Research in European Studies
description: Supervised research on a modern European topic chosen in consultation with the student's adviser and culminating in a full-length thesis. Individual instruction. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing, admission to the European studies major, and consent of instructor.
